docs.snippet: Barclays Center has a somewhat forbidding atmosphere for visiting teams. The music pumped through the arena’s loudspeakers, hand-selected by the mix-tape artist J. Period, has an aggressive attitude. The black-clad Brooklynettes dance team ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Barclays Center has a somewhat forbidding atmosphere for visiting teams. The music pumped through the arena’s loudspeakers, hand-selected by the mix-tape artist J. Period, has an aggressive attitude. The black-clad Brooklynettes dance team has a decidedly adult attitude. And the Nets, in black home uniforms that are in stark contrast with typical N.B.A. fashion, certainly look tough, even if their game is based on offensive execution more than any sort of intimidation.
 
For the Nets’ first-round playoff series against the Chicago Bulls, the arena will grow even darker, with the team distributing black T-shirts to fans in hopes of creating a “blackout” in the crowd.
docs.abstract: Off The Dribble column notes that Brooklyn Nets will distribute black T-shirts to fans in hopes of creating 'blackout' in arena crowd, looking to exploit home turf advantage in first-round playoff series against Chicago Bulls. (M)p

docs.snippet: Little boys like mine need to move their bodies, to explore and wrestle and chase each other around. They need to shake the ants out of their pants, and city life just doesn’t allow for it....

docs.snippet: You can get behind the wheel of a sportsman dragster, but be warned: it is a far cry from jamming the gas pedal in a race to the next red light....
docs.lead_paragraph: You can get behind the wheel of a sportsman dragster, but be warned: it is a far cry from jamming the gas pedal in a race to the next red light.
docs.abstract: Viv Bernstein shares her one-day session with Doug Foley’s Drag Racing Experience; sportsman dragsters she drove could reach only 140 mph, which was fast enough to feel some G-forces and get sense of precision needed to guide roaring dragster down track.

headline.seo: Among Drag Racing’s Challenges Are G-Forces and Getting Your Feet to Reach the Pedals
headline.main: Reaching G-Forces, but First the Pedals
headline.print_headline: Reaching G-Forces, But First the Pedals

docs.snippet: When a minister defended racial profiling, I told her to take a walk in my skin....
docs.lead_paragraph: When a minister defended racial profiling, I told her to take a walk in my skin.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Jonas Hassen Khemiri underscores problem of racism in Sweden, and cites as an example Beatric Ask, country's justice minister, who said those who had been racially profiled on subways were irrational for getting angry.
